pli-tv-bu-vb-sk43:2.1: The monks’ rules and their analysis
pli-tv-bu-vb-sk43:5.1: 43. The training rule on with a mouthful
pli-tv-bu-vb-sk43:6.1: At one time the Buddha was staying at Sāvatthī in the Jeta Grove, Anāthapiṇḍika’s Monastery.
pli-tv-bu-vb-sk43:6.2: At that time the monks from the group of six talked with food in their mouths. …
pli-tv-bu-vb-sk43:7.2: “‘I will not speak with food in my mouth,’ this is how you should train.”
pli-tv-bu-vb-sk43:8.1: One should not speak with food in one’s mouth.
pli-tv-bu-vb-sk43:8.2: If a monk out of disrespect speaks with food in his mouth, he commits an offense of wrong conduct.
pli-tv-bu-vb-sk43:9.2: if it is unintentional; if he is not mindful; if he does not know; if he is sick; if there are dangers; if he is insane;
pli-tv-bu-vb-sk43:9.3: if he is the first offender.
pli-tv-bu-vb-sk43:10.1: The third training rule is finished.
